page.title: 06Local History & Place Names
page.content: The area was largely dominated in the past by the coal industry. The coal seams, owned by the Duke of Hamilton were exploited by a number of mines, Eddlewood, Cadzow and (just outside our area) Quarter. Since the seams ran down towards the Clyde, they eventually undermined Hamilton Palace itself. {PLACE NAMES} Eddlewood means "Freeholding in the wood". This is an area of land, held without Few Superior, and the castle that marked the estate stood at the junction of the Blacklog and Simpsonland Burns and was destroyed after Langside in 1568. Earnock means "The hill of the sloes", but there is no sign of these today.
